meanings.definition: The fact or state of living or having objective reality.
meanings.sent1: Many different existences can be found in nature.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the existences of various species in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The existence of talking animals in the story made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fiction, the existence of magical creatures is common.
meanings.sent5: The existence of ghosts in the old house was a topic of much debate.

meanings.definition: The way in which something is real and can be perceived, understood, or experienced.
meanings.sent1: The artist's paintings captured different existences of emotions.
meanings.sent2: Philosophers often ponder the existences of truth and beauty.
meanings.sent3: The existence of a purple elephant in the room was quite surprising.
meanings.sent4: Her poetry delves into the existence of love in all its forms.
meanings.sent5: The existence of kindness in the world brings hope to many.

meanings.definition: The state of being present or available for use.
meanings.sent1: The existence of fresh fruits in the market delighted the shoppers.
meanings.sent2: The existence of clean water is essential for life.
meanings.sent3: The existence of a helpful robot in the house made chores easier.
meanings.sent4: The existence of a shortcut saved them a lot of time.
meanings.sent5: The existence of a map made navigating the forest much simpler.
